alert.note: Alert for Ashe; Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Watauga and southwestern Ashe Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 716 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Silverstone, or near Ashland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Jefferson... Ashland... Trout... Baldwin... Clifton... Shatley Springs... and Silverstone. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northwestern North Carolina...and southwestern Virginia.
